eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: A button that can be used for menus and most labelled buttons of a game. The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

changelog.breaking: - Buttons now use "variants", allowing easy swapping of their visual aspect. You will have to make some adjustments to existing buttons in your project. Follow this [migration documentation](https://wiki.gdevelop.io/gdevelop5/objects/custom-objects-prefab-template/migrate-to-variants/) to do these changes.

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: grymmjack
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AlignObject
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Align objects on the scene relatively to the window (or screen size).
description: Align objects on the scene relatively to the window (or screen size).
**Be sure to put your object on a layer for which the camera position was not moved.**
Actions provided are:
* ToSceneCentered: horizontally and vertically centered in scene
* ToSceneTop: vertically to the top in scene
* ToSceneMiddle: vertically to the middle in scene
* ToSceneBottom: vertically to the bottom in scene
* ToSceneLeft: horizontally to the left in scene
* ToSceneRight: horizontally to the right in scene
* ToSceneCenter: horizontally to the center in scene
* ToScreenCentered: horizontally and vertically centered in screen
* ToScreenTop: vertically to the top in screen
* ToScreenMiddle: vertically to the middle in screen
* ToScreenBottom: vertically to the bottom in screen
* ToScreenLeft: horizontally to the left in screen
* ToScreenRight: horizontally to the right in screen
* ToScreenCenter: horizontally to the center in screen

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @Lizard-13
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SnapToGrid
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Snap objects on a virtual grid.
description: It allows to snap objects on a *virtual 2D grid*.
It's useful for:
- level editors
- building systems
A [simple example](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://snap-object-to-grid) shows how to snap objects that are dragged with the mouse.

eventsFunctions.description: Snap object to a virtual grid (i.e: this is not the grid used in the editor).
eventsFunctions.fullName: Snap objects to a virtual grid
eventsFunctions.name: SnapObjectToVirtualGrid
eventsFunctions.sentence: Snap _PARAM1_ to a virtual grid using cells with width: _PARAM2_px, height _PARAM3_px and an offset position (_PARAM4_; _PARAM5_)

events.comment: Round the Object position to snap to the in-game grid

parameters.description: Objects to snap to the virtual grid
parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: Width of a cell of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: CellWidth

parameters.description: Height of a cell of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: CellHeight

parameters.description: Offset on the X axis of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: OffsetX

parameters.description: Offset on the Y axis of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: OffsetY
